text:

IPFS Attachments

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/attachment]]

The specialized [[IPFS Attachments]] Tiddler displays the <> tag.

The [[IPFS Attachments]] Tiddler is available in the [[TableOfContents]].

text:
Requirement

title: Console
text:
Desktop Console

On desktop the [[Verbose]] mode output feedbacks to the browser console and the Mobile console.

  • [[Chrome or Chromium Console|https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/open]]
  • [[Firefox Console|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Web_Console/Opening_the_Web_Console]]
[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/console]]

Mobile Console

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki embeds a light console who provides feedback on mobile and desktop.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/mobile/console]]

title: Decrypt External Resource
text:
Decrypt External Resource

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/unencrypt]]

If the locker is closed your wiki is encrypted or will be encrypted once saved.

A password will be requested to unlock your wiki when loaded.

External resources are automatically unencrypted when their host Tiddlers are displayed.

While unencrypting an external resource, a password could be requested:

  • When the wiki is unencrypted but its external resource is encrypted
  • When the wiki is encrypted but the encrypted external resource uses a different password

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/unencrypt/password]]

[[IPFS - Encrypted - The Little Prince]] describes this behaviour.

Edit the this Tiddler as it contains a password field . Its value when used will unencrypt the external resource.

title: ENS Settings
text:
ENS Settings

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ens]]

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki is able to publish .eth domains to [ext[ENS|https://ens.domains/]]. Either a new or updated wiki and attachments associated with an IPFS identifier could be publish to ENS.

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki embeds an ENS resolver. Any .eth domains will be resolved to its associated IPFS identifier on any supported [ext[ENS Networks|https://docs.ens.domains/ens-deployments]].

ENS is powered by a set of [ext[Ethereum Smart Contracts|https://ethereum.org/learn/]] and runs on the Ethereum blockchain.

Rather than accessing a wiki with a complex to remember URL:

[ext[https://gateway.ipfs.io/ipfs/QmaPUjsVEmTZTXxrvxQDMcd7FpSPVac52mj72dkzRpUQQV]]

ENS offers a secure & decentralised way to address resources both on and off the blockchain using simple, human-readable names.

ENS eliminates the need to copy or type long addresses. With ENS, you'll be able to send money to your friend at 'aardvark.eth' instead of '0x4cbe58c50480...', interact with your favorite contract at 'mycontract.eth', or visit an IPFS hosted site at 'ipfssite.eth'.

Resolve ENS with IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki

<$ipfslink value="bluelightav.eth"/>

Resolve ENS with a browser extension

[ext[https://bluelightav.eth]]

Browsers

To use the ENS feature your environment needs the Ethereum knowledge.

On Desktop you need a supported browser:

  • [ext[Firefox|https://www.mozilla.org]]
  • [ext[Chrome|https://www.google.com/chrome/]]
  • [ext[Chromium|https://www.chromium.org]]

Browser extensions

With the following supported Ethereum browser extension:

  • [ext[Metamask|https://metamask.io]]

New browser extensions are landing who resolve .eth domain:

  • [ext[Almonit|https://github.com/almonit/almonit-plugin]]
  • [ext[Unstoppable Domain|https://github.com/unstoppabledomains/resolution-browser-extension]]

Mobile

On Mobile you need a supported Đapp browser:

  • [ext[Metamask|https://metamask.io]]

Desktop

We recommend [ext[Metamask|https://metamask.io]] as the browser extension is able to resolve the .eth domain name when you input an .eth domain in your browser address bar.

Publishing

To publish to ENS while saving:

  • The [[ENS|Protocol]] protocol must be selected
  • The [[ENS domain|ENS Settings]] field must be filled

To publish without saving see [[Publish TiddlyWiki to ENS]].

While saving the plugin will:

  • Verify if the ENS domain is valid
  • Verify and load the associated ENS domain resolver
  • Save the wiki over IPFS
  • Interact with your Ethereum wallet
  • Update the associated ENS domain resolver content with the new IPFS identifier on the Ethereum blockchain
  • [[Unpin]] the previous version if this option is selected
  • Redirect to the ENS domain when the transaction is successfull
  • Or redirect to the IPFS saved wiki if the ENS transaction do not succeed.

The default ENS domain is stored in the following Tiddler [[$:/ipfs/saver/ens/domain]].

Supported ENS Ethereum Networks

  • `Mainnet`: Ethereum Main Network
  • `Ropsten`: Ethereum Test Network (~PoW)
  • `Rinkeby`: Ethereum Test Network (~PoA)
  • `Goerli`: Ethereum Test Network (~PoA)

Reference

  • [ext[ENS|https://ens.domains]]
  • [ext[ENS Application Manager|https://app.ens.domains]]
  • [ext[ENS Discourse|https://discuss.ens.domains/]]
  • [ext[ENS Documentation|https://docs.ens.domains]]
  • [ext[Ethereum|https://www.ethereum.org]]

ENS Domain Manager

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ens/manager]]

This command opens the default ENS Domain Manager.

Resolve ENS Domain

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ens/resolve]]

This command resolves and opens the default ENS Domain.

See the [ext[README.md|https://github.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/blob/main/README.md]] for more informations.

title: Embed Attachment
text:
Embed Attachment

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/ipfs]]

Embedding an attachment means retrieving from IPFS a content back to your wiki.

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki lets you embed from IPFS the following supported [[Media Types]].

Edit your Tiddler and remove the field _canonical_uri.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/remove/canonical]]

Save your Tiddler. The attachment is automatically embedded in your wiki. A password could be requested if you embed an encrypted attachment.

Experiment

Edit [[/ipfs/documentation/documents/IPFS - The Little Prince]] and remove the _canonical_uri field, save your Tiddler. The external resource will be embedded in your wiki.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/embedded]]

When you'll save your document IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki will unpin the previous IPFS external resources if the [[Unpin]] has been selected.

While embedding an attachment from IPFS the plugin will:

  • Download the attachment from IPFS
  • Decrypt the attachment if applicable
  • Embed the attachment in your wiki
  • Request to Unpin the previous IPFS identifier
  • Update the Tiddler tags

tags

The export command manages some tags to highlight the Tiddler semantic:

  • <>
  • <>
  • <>

title: Encrypt External Resource
text:
Encrypt External Resource

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/encrypt]]

If the locker is opened, your wiki is not encrypted.

Follow the official [ext[Encryption|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Encryption]] tutorial from ~TiddlyWiki for more informations.

The default official ~TiddlyWiki behaviour do not encrypt external resources.

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki enhances this behaviour.

Once you've locked and password protected your wiki, uploaded resources will be encrypted.

Read the [[Export Attachment]] reference for more informations.

Beware that even you've locked your wiki and didn't save it immediately already uploaded external resources are encrypted.

Read the [[Decrypt External Resource]] to manage this behaviour.

title: Export
text:
Export Setting

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/export]]

The Export setting controls the way IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki export your Tiddler over IPFS. This setting only applies to the [[Export Tiddler]] command as the [[Export Content]] always uses the [ext[JSON|https://www.json.org/]] lightweight data-interchange format.

JSON

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/export/json]]

Static

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/export/static]]

TID

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/export/tid]]

title: Export Attachment
text:
Export Attachment

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/export/attachment]]

Exporting an embedded attachment means exporting to IPFS a content from your wiki.

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki lets you export to IPFS the following supported [[Media Types]].

Uploading to IPFS an attachment could be a slow process. It depends its size and/or which server your are using.

Use the [[https://ipfs.infura.io:5001 API URL|IPFS Server Settings]] and the [[https://ipfs.infura.io Gateway URL|IPFS Server Settings]] and experiment with [[/ipfs/documentation/documents/IPFS - The Little Prince]].

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/console]]

Another good experiment is to use the [[https://ipfs.infura.io:5001 API URL|IPFS Server Settings]] and the [[https://dweb.link Gateway URL|IPFS Server Settings]]. You upload your attachment on infura and spread its content to another server.

Attachment once exported to IPFS are not immediately pinned. The pinning process occurs when you save your wiki.

While exporting an attachment to IPFS the plugin will:

  • Verify if the current Tiddler contains an attachment
  • Verify if the current attachment is already exported
  • Extract the attachment from your wiki
  • Encrypt the attachment if applicable
  • Upload the attachment to IPFS
  • Request to Pin the new IPFS identifier
  • Update or create the Tiddler _canonical_uri field with the new IPFS identifier
  • Update the Tiddler tags

tags

The export command manages some tags to highlight the Tiddler semantic:

  • <>
  • <>
  • <>

title: Export Content
text:
Export Content

Exporting a content means exporting to IPFS a set of Tiddlers from your wiki.

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki uses the [ext[JSON|https://www.json.org/]] lightweight data-interchange format to export content.

  • [[/ipfs/image/settings/export/json]]

While exporting to IPFS the plugin will:

  • Resolve an IPNS key and its IPNS cid if applicable
  • Resolve an ENS domain if applicable
  • Extract the Tiddlers Link if applicable
  • Transclude the content if applicable
  • Build a set of JSON Tiddlers
  • Encrypt the content if applicable
  • Export the content to IPFS
  • Pin the content
  • Update or create the Tiddler _export_uri field with the new IPFS identifier
  • Publish to IPNS the new IPFS identifier if applicable
  • Publish to ENS the new IPFS identifier if applicable
  • Unpin the previous IPFS identifier if applicable
  • Update the Tiddler _export_uri field with the previous IPNS cid or IPNS key if applicable
  • Update the Tiddler _export_uri field with the previous ENS domain if applicable
  • Update the Tiddler tags

Example

Edit [[IPFS Documentation Assets]].

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/documentation/asset/content]]

Notice the transclusion notation available in the text field. Close the Tiddler and execute the following command.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/export/content]]

Check the console output for more details.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/export/console]]

Edit [[IPFS Documentation Assets]] and notice the new _export_uri field.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/export/uri]]

Click the _export_uri field.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/export/json]]

_export_uri

The field _export_uri store your IPFS identifier. If you want to export to a specific IPNS identifier or ENS domain you need to create manually and fill up the field with an appropriate content before exporting.

_export_uri content examples

  • `ipfs://cid`
  • `/ipfs/cid`
  • `ipns://name`
  • `/ipns/name`
  • `ipns://cid`
  • `/ipns/cid`
  • `doc.bluelightav.eth`
  • `https://doc.bluelightav.eth`

tags

The export command manages some tags to highlight the Tiddler semantic:

  • <>
  • <>

title: Export Tiddler
text:
Export Tiddler

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/export/tiddler]]

Exporting a Tiddler means exporting to IPFS a Tiddler content from your wiki.

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki lets you [[Export]] to IPFS the following format:

  • JSON [[/ipfs/image/settings/export/json]]
  • Static [[/ipfs/image/settings/export/static]]
  • TID [[/ipfs/image/settings/export/tid]]

While exporting to IPFS the plugin will:

  • Resolve an IPNS key and its IPNS cid if applicable
  • Resolve an ENS domain if applicable
  • Extract the content
  • Encrypt the content if applicable
  • Export the content to IPFS
  • Pin the content
  • Update or create the Tiddler _export_uri field with the new IPFS identifier
  • Publish to IPNS the new IPFS identifier if applicable
  • Publish to ENS the new IPFS identifier if applicable
  • Unpin the previous IPFS identifier if applicable
  • Update the Tiddler _export_uri field with the previous IPNS cid or IPNS key if applicable
  • Update the Tiddler _export_uri field with the previous ENS domain if applicable
  • Update the Tiddler tags

_export_uri

The field _export_uri store your IPFS identifier. If you want to export to a specific IPNS identifier or ENS domain you need to create manually and fill up the field with an appropriate content before exporting.

_export_uri content examples

  • `ipfs://cid
  • `/ipfs/cid
  • `ipns://name
  • `/ipns/name
  • `ipns://cid
  • `/ipns/cid
  • `doc.bluelightav.eth`

tags

The export command manages some tags to highlight the Tiddler semantic:

  • <>
  • <>

title: IPFS Documentation
text:
Requirements

  • [[IPFS Quick Start]]

IPFS Documentation

<>

title: IPFS Link Widget
text: The `ipfslink` widget generates links to tiddlers and external resources. It resolves IPNS and ENS domain if applicable. If no tiddlers are found or the value cannot be resolved as an URL the content will be rendered as text. ! Content and Attributes The content of the ipfslink widget is rendered within the `` tag representing the link. `<$ipfslink/>` is equivalent to `<$ipfslink value=<>><$view field="title"/>`. `<$ipfslink value="blueligtav.eth"/>` is equivalent to `<$ipfslink value="bluelightav.eth">bluelightav.eth`. Example: [[Welcome]] `<$ipfslink field="_canonical_uri" tiddler=<>/>`. Example: [[$:/core/ui/EditTemplate/body]] `<$ipfslink value=<> field=<> tiddler=<>/>`. Example: [[$:/core/ui/EditTemplate/fields]] |!Attribute |!Description | |value |Optional Tiddler Title, URL or field processed as a link if possible| |field |Optional Tiddler field from which the value will be extracted| |tiddler |Optional Tiddler Title from which the field will be extracted| The IPFS Link Widget inherits the [ext[LinkWidget|https://tiddlywiki.com/#LinkWidget]] characteristics.

title: IPFS Provider
text:
IPFS Provider Setting

Warning
The IPFS Companion support is temporarily disabled.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/provider]]

IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki is able to reach the IPFS network with multiple providers:

  • [ext[IPFS Companion|https://github.com/ipfs-shipyard/ipfs-companion]]
  • [ext[Http Client|https://github.com/ipfs/js-ipfs-http-client]]

Options:

  1. Default
    • Use IPFS Companion if available
    • Otherwise use the HTTP Client provider
  2. Use only the IPFS Companion provider if available
  3. Use only the HTTP Client provider

When the [[Verbose]] property is selected, the console shows which provider has been selected.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/provider/console]]

title: IPFS Quick Start
text:
IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki Quick Start

Current

  • [[$:/boot/boot.js]] {{$:/boot/boot.js!!version}} <$ipfslink value=<>>[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]
  • [[IPFS Documentation|IPFS Documentation Assets]] {{IPFS Documentation Assets!!version}} <$ipfslink value=<>>[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]
  • [[$:/library/ipfs.js]] {{$:/library/ipfs.js!!version}} <$ipfslink value=<>>[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]
  • [[$:/plugins/ipfs]] {{$:/plugins/ipfs!!version}} <$ipfslink value=<>>[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]

Latest

  • `$:/boot/boot.js` <$ipfslink value="https://tiddly.bluelightav.eth/tiddlywiki-ipfs/boot/latest-build/">[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]
  • `IPFS Documentation` <$ipfslink value="https://tiddly.bluelightav.eth/tiddlywiki-ipfs/documentation/latest-build/">[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]
  • `$:/library/ipfs.js` <$ipfslink value="https://tiddly.bluelightav.eth/tiddlywiki-ipfs/library/latest-build/">[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]
  • `$:/plugins/ipfs` <$ipfslink value="https://tiddly.bluelightav.eth/tiddlywiki-ipfs/plugin/latest-build/">[img[Available on IPFS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ipfs]]

Release

  • [[IPFS with TiddlyWiki Documentation|IPFS Documentation]] <$ipfslink value="https://bluelightav.eth/#IPFS%20Documentation">[img[Resolve with ENS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ens]] [img[Resolve with DNS Link|$:/ipfs/core/icons/dns]]
  • [[$:/plugins/ipfs]] <$ipfslink value="https://bluelightav.eth/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fipfs">[img[Resolve with ENS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ens]] [img[Resolve with DNS Link|$:/ipfs/core/icons/dns]]
  • bluelightav.eth <$ipfslink value="https://bluelightav.eth">[img[Resolve with ENS|$:/ipfs/core/icons/ens]] [img[Resolve with DNS Link|$:/ipfs/core/icons/dns]]

Mandatory Third parties plugin

  • [ext[Locator Plugin|https://bimlas.gitlab.io/tw5-locator/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fbimlas%2Flocator]]

Optional Third parties plugin

  • [ext[Relink Plugin|https://flibbles.github.io/tw5-relink/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fflibbles%2Frelink]]

Ethereum

  • [ext[Metamask|https://metamask.io]]

We do not recommmend to work at the file system level as modern browsers limits interactions from the file system and web servers.

  • [ext[Chrome Cross-Origin XMLHttpRequest|https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/xhr]]
  • [ext[Firefox Cross-Origin Resource Sharing|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS]]

However if you want to work at the file system level an easy solution is to install a local web server.

  • [ext[Web Server for Chrome|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/web-server-for-chrome/ofhbbkphhbklhfoeikjpcbhemlocgigb]]
  • [ext[Firefox - Set up a Local Testing Server|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Common_questions/set_up_a_local_testing_server]]

As a convenience here is our [[Node Configuration|IPFS Server Config]] suitable for [ext[IPFS Desktop|https://github.com/ipfs-shipyard/ipfs-desktop]] and the [ext[IPFS Go Server|https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs]].

This configuration is based on the [ext[v0.8.0|https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/releases/tag/v0.8.0]] version.

More informations about the configuration parameters are available [ext[here|https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/blob/master/docs/config.md]]

title: IPFS Server Config
IPFS Server Settings
text:
IPFS Server Settings

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/server/ipfs]]

To save your wiki over IPFS, you need to select:

  • An [ext[API URL|https://docs.ipfs.io/reference/api/http/]] where the IPFS commands are sent
  • A [ext[Gateway URL|https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/blob/master/docs/gateway.md]] where IPFS contents are retrieved

While saving the plugin will:

  • Save the wiki over IPFS
  • Pin the new wiki over IPFS
  • [[Unpin]] the previous version if this option is selected
  • Redirect the current page to the new IPFS identifier

URL Selection

The plugin eases URL selections through drop-down lists.

API URL

<>

To enhance the API URL list:

  • Clone an existing API URL Tiddler
  • Update the cloned Tiddler's title and text
  • Update the [[Default API URL|$:/ipfs/saver/api]] text if applicable

Gateway URL

<>

To enhance the Gateway URL list:

  • Clone an existing Gateway URL Tiddler
  • Update the cloned Tiddler's title and text
  • Update the [[Default Gateway URL|$:/ipfs/saver/gateway]] if applicable

title: IPFS Standards
text:
IPFS Standards

Here is an exhaustive list of standards followed by IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki

  1. [ext[Console|https://console.spec.whatwg.org/]] with [ext[Eruda|https://github.com/liriliri/eruda]]
  2. [ext[Continuous Integration|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_integration]] with [ext[Travis|https://travis-ci.com/]]
  3. [ext[DevSecOps|https://www.devsecops.org/]] with [ext[Snyk|https://snyk.io/]]
  4. [ext[JavaScript Standard|https://standardjs.com/]]
  5. [ext[Linting with Eslint|https://eslint.org/]]
  6. [ext[Open Source Projects|https://www.fsf.org/]]
  7. [ext[Testing with Mocha|https://mochajs.org/]]
  8. Transparency with [ext[Ethereum|https://ethereum.org]] and [ext[GitHub|https://github.com/]]

title: IPFS Technical
text:
Requirements

  • [[IPFS Quick Start]]

Technical

<>

title: IPNS Settings
text:
IPNS Settings

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ipns]]

The plugin is able to publish your IPNS key with a new IPFS cid everytime you save your wiki.

To publish to IPNS while saving:

  • The [[IPNS|Protocol]] protocol must be selected
  • The IPNS key field must be filled

To publish without saving see [[Publish TiddlyWiki to IPNS]].

While saving the plugin will:

  • Save the wiki over IPFS
  • Resolve the current IPNS key and IPNS cid if you come from an existing IPNS URL
  • Or resolve the default IPNS key and IPNS cid if you come from the local filesystem or an IPFS URL
  • Publish the IPFS key with the new IPFS cid
  • [[Unpin]] the previous IPFS content if this option is selected
  • Redirect the current page to your IPNS cid if successfully published
  • Or redirect to the IPFS saved wiki if the IPNS update do not succeed.

This feature do not work with IPFS Companion or the https://ipfs.infura.io:5001 [[API URL|IPFS Server Settings]].

  • The default IPNS key is stored in the following Tiddler [[$:/ipfs/saver/ipns/key]]
  • The default IPNS cid is store in the following Tiddler [[$:/ipfs/saver/ipns/cid]]

Rename IPNS key

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ipns/rename]]

This command rename an existing IPNS key.

  • Fetch an existing IPNS key
  • The associated IPNS cid is displayed
  • Update the current IPNS key in the input field
  • Use the rename command

Generate IPNS cid

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ipns/generate]]

This command generates a new IPNS cid associated with an IPNS key.

Remove IPNS key and IPNS cid

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ipns/remove]]

This command removes an IPNS key and its associated IPNS cid.

Fetch IPNS cid

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ipns/fetch]]

This command fetch an IPNS cid associated with an IPNS key.

Open resolved IPNS cid

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/ipns/resolve]]

This command resolves an IPNS cid to its associated IPFS cid if any and displays its content in a new browser tab.

title: Import
text:
Import

Besides the _canonical_uri field, IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki introduces a new special field _import_uri. The _canonical_uri references either an attachment or a Tiddler while the _import_uri references the imported file. When the imported file directly hosts an imported Tiddler only the _canonical_uri is present.

This technic lets you import and re-export Tiddlers giving the flexibility to exchange Tiddlers between users.

The import is not limited to IPFS as [[URL]] lets you import JSON Tiddlers from wherever you want.

Create a Tiddler and defines a _canonical_uri field. Fill up the canonical_uri field with the following URL [ext[Sample|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/sample/root.json]]. Save your Tiddler. You should see the following result.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/import]]

Check the output from the browser [[Console]] for further details.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/import/console]]

Edit the imported Tiddlers and browse the [[URL]] associated with fields _canonical_uri or _import_uri.

The [[Refresh Tiddler]] command forces an import refresh. Deleted Tiddlers could occur.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/import/deleted]]

This imported sample references multiple files with relative [[URL]].

  • [ext[Root|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/sample/root.json]]
  • [ext[Level_1_2|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/sample/level_1_2.json]]
  • [ext[Level_2_1|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/sample/level_2_1.json]]
  • [ext[Level_3_1|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/sample/level_3_1.json]]
  • [ext[Level_4_1|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/sample/level_4_1.json]]

Importing is a four steps process:

  • Load external resources (attachments are not loaded)
  • Process imported Tiddlers and discard duplicates
  • Merge imported Tiddlers
  • Delete previous non-existing imported Tiddlers

You can experiment the errors processed with the load and import process with the following samples. Beware that multiple dialog boxes will popup with specific errors.

  • [ext[Load|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/load/root.json]]
  • [ext[Process|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xmaysonnave/tiddlywiki-ipfs/main/test/import/process/root.json]]

title: Imported Tiddlers
text:
Requirement

  • [ext[Locator plugin for TiddlyWiki|https://bimlas.gitlab.io/tw5-locator/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fbimlas%2Flocator]]

IPFS Imported Tiddlers

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/imported/tiddlers]]

The specialized [[IPFS Imported Tiddlers]] displays the <> tag.

The [[IPFS Imported Tiddlers]] is available in the [[TableOfContents]].

title: Networks
text:
IPFS

IPFS identifiers:

  • [ext[CID Inspector|https://cid.ipfs.io]]

IPFS networks :

  • [ext[Infura Status|https://status.infura.io]]
  • [ext[Public IPFS Gateways|https://ipfs.github.io/public-gateway-checker/]]

Ethereum

[ext[Chainlist|https://chainlist.org/]] Networks:

  • [ext[Binance|https://bscscan.com/]]: Binance Smart Chain Network (~PoSA)
  • [ext[Binance|https://testnet.bscscan.com/]]: Binance Smart Chain Test Network (~PoSA)
  • [ext[Chainlist|https://chainlist.org/]]: List of EVM Networks
  • [ext[Etherchain Charts|https://www.etherchain.org/charts]]
  • [ext[Ethereum Gas Station|https://ethgasstation.info/]]
  • [ext[Ethereum Gas Tracker|http://etherscan.io/gastracker]]

  • [ext[Kovan|https://kovan.etherscan.io]]: Ethereum Test Network (~PoA)

  • [ext[Ropsten|https://ropsten.etherscan.io/]]: Ethereum Test Network (~PoW)
  • [ext[xDai|https://blockscout.com/poa/xdai]]: xDai Main Network (~PoA)

Mnemonic

  • [ext[Mnemonic Code Converter v0.5.2|https://bafybeifxjfycpkureyy47g6dmtiqckijybx3gehxakwnysz5qsjiosmysi.ipfs.dweb.link/]]

title: Pin External Resource
text:
Pin External Resource to IPFS

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/view/pin]]

The pin to IPFS command immediately pins all the fields who contain an IPFS URL using the [[Default API URL|$:/ipfs/saver/api]]:

title: Pin TiddlyWiki
text:
Pin ~TiddlyWiki to IPFS

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/page/pin]]

The pin to IPFS command pins the current ~TiddlyWiki IPFS identifier using the [[Default API URL|$:/ipfs/saver/api]].

A dialog box will be displayed at the end of the process.

title: Preferred Saver
text:
Preferred Saver Setting

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/preferred/saver]]

The plugin modifies the default behaviour of ~TiddlyWiki and exposes the available savers.

This feature is a work in progress with the [ext[TiddlyWiki|https://github.com/Jermolene/TiddlyWiki5/pull/4371]] community.

The default value Ipfs defines IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki as the default saver.

If you want to save locally your wiki select the download value and the default local filesystem saver will be called.

Preferred Saver Selection

The plugin eases the Preferred Saver selection with a drop-down list.

The selected value is stored in the [[Preferred Saver|$:/config/PreferredSaver]] Tiddler.

title: Protocol
text:
Protocol Setting

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/protocol]]

The Protocol setting controls the way IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki saves your wiki over IPFS.

IPFS

The [[IPFS|IPFS Server Settings]] protocol saves ~TiddlyWiki and its embedded file attachments over IPFS.

Once your wiki is saved you'll be redirected to the new IPFS identifier location.

IPNS

The [[IPNS|IPNS Settings]] protocol enhances the IPFS protocol and publishes an IPNS key with a new [[IPFS|IPFS Server Settings]] identifier.

The [[IPNS|IPNS Settings]] protocol uses the IPNS key and its IPNS cid defined in your [[IPNS Settings]].

Once your wiki is saved you'll be redirected to the new IPNS identifier location.

ENS

The [[ENS|ENS Settings]] protocol enhances the IPFS protocol and publishes a new [[IPFS|IPFS Server Settings]] identifier to an [[ENS|ENS Settings]] domain or [[ENS|ENS Settings]] subdomain.

Once your wiki is saved you'll be redirected to your [[ENS|ENS Settings]] domain or [[ENS|ENS Settings]] subdomain.

If you comes from an [[IPNS|IPNS Settings]] identifier the [[ENS|ENS Settings]] protocol always updates your previous [[IPNS|IPNS Settings]] identifier.

title: Publish TiddlyWiki to ENS
text:
Publish ~TiddlyWiki to ENS

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/publish/ens]]

The publish to ENS command updates an ENS .eth domain with the current IPFS identifier.

While publishing to ENS the plugin will:

  • Verify if the ENS domain is valid
  • Verify and load the associated ENS domain resolver
  • Interact with your Ethereum wallet
  • Update the associated ENS domain resolver content with the new IPFS identifier on the Ethereum blockchain
  • [[Unpin]] the previous version if this option is selected

When you use this command you will not be redirected to your ENS domain once completed.

[ext[Metamask|https://metamask.io]] will request your authorization as your Ethereum account is involved.

[img class="tc-image-documentation-small" [/ipfs/image/metamask/allow]]

In the next step you need to fund your transaction.

[img class="tc-image-documentation-small" [/ipfs/image/metamask/gas]]

The minimum required gas is, 0.000000015 ether or 15 gwei (around 15 cents).
For faster transaction 25 to 35 gwei could be necessary.

Check the [[Networks]] for further details about the current gas price.

Publishing to ENS is a lengthy process. The [[Console]] will provide an URL to check the ongoing transaction. A dialog box will be displayed at the end of the process.

title: Publish TiddlyWiki to IPNS
text:
Publish ~TiddlyWiki to IPNS

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/publish/ipns]]

The publish to IPNS command publishes the [[IPNS key|IPNS Settings]] with the current wiki IPFS identifier using the [[Default API URL|$:/ipfs/saver/api]].

You can publish an [[IPNS key|IPNS Settings]] with the IPFS identifier of another IPNS key.

While publishing to IPNS the plugin will:

  • Verify the IPNS key and its IPNS cid if both are filled
  • Resolve the IPNS cid if only the IPNS key is filled
  • Resolve the IPNS key if only the IPNS cid is filled
  • Publish the IPFS key with the new IPFS identifier
  • [[Unpin]] the previous IPFS content if this option is selected

A dialog box will be displayed at the end of the process.

title: Refresh Tiddler
text:
Refresh Tiddler

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/view/refresh]]

The refresh action reloads the current Tiddler.

It implements the following behaviour:

  • Imported Tiddlers are reloaded.
  • External attachments are reloaded. It is a useful behaviour when you declined to unencrypt an encrypted external resource. The unencrypt password dialog box will be displayed again.
  • Regular Tiddler are removed from the ~TiddlyWiki cache and reloaded. It is a useful behaviour when you want to load content from a different IPFS gateway.
  • [[Imported|Import]] Tiddlers are reloaded.

title: Relative URL Policy
text:
Relative URL Policy Setting

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/relative/url/policy]]

The Relative URL Policy setting controls the way relative URL are resolved.

Origin

Relative URL are resolved against their origin.

Gateway

Relative URL are resolved against the [[Gateway URL|IPFS Server Settings]].

The following [[URI Schemes |URL]] are relative to an Origin or a Gateway.

  • `ipfs:`
  • `ipns:`

title: Settings
text:
Requirement

  • [ext[Locator plugin for TiddlyWiki|https://bimlas.gitlab.io/tw5-locator/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fbimlas%2Flocator]]

Settings

The [[IPFS Saver Settings|$:/core/ui/ControlPanel/Ipfs/Saver]] lets you control the plugin behaviour.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings]] <>

title: Tiddler Commands
text:
Requirement

  • [ext[Locator plugin for TiddlyWiki|https://bimlas.gitlab.io/tw5-locator/#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fbimlas%2Flocator]]

Tiddler Commands

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/view/toolbar]] <>

title: URL
text:
URL

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/url/hovering]]

Editing a Tiddler is improved while using the [[IPFS Link Widget]]. Fields could be processed as Tiddler links, External Links or plain texts.

An URL could be absolute or relative to their [[Origin or Gateway|Relative URL Policy]]. An URL follows the [ext[WHATWG-URL|https://wiki.whatwg.org/]] standard.

However to discriminate any fields content a few rules should be followed:

An absolute URL could use the following [ext[URI Schemes|https://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes/uri-schemes.xhtml]].

  • `about`
  • `blob`
  • `data`
  • `file`
  • `ftp`
  • `http`
  • `https`
  • `ipfs`
  • `ipns`
  • `mailto`

A relative URL should start with the following:

  • `/`
  • `./`
  • `../`

A right-click on any URL field gives users a chance to open a new browser tab and load the URL. However a direct click on the link will fully resolve any IPNS identifiers or ENS domains and open a new browser tab.

URL analysis steps:

  • Locate an existing Tiddler title who matches the field content
  • Parse the field content as an absolute URL
  • Parse the field content as a relative URL
  • Fallback as plain text

title: Unpin
text:
Unpin Setting

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/unpin]]

The Unpin checkbox when selected try to unpin previous contents while saving.

Each time you save your wiki, publish to [[IPNS|IPNS Settings]] or publish to [[ENS|ENS Settings]] the previous content will be unpined.

When you embed in your wiki a previously saved IPFS attachment, an Unpin request will be recorded and processed while saving.

The same mechanism applies to exported contents.

Unpinning is not allowed with the [[API URL|IPFS Server Settings]] ipfs.infura.io:5001.

title: Unpin External Resource
text:
Unpin External Resource from IPFS

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/view/unpin]]

The unpin from IPFS command immediately unpins all the fields who contain an IPFS URL using the [[Default API URL|$:/ipfs/saver/api]]:

title: Unpin TiddlyWiki
text:
Unpin ~TiddlyWiki from IPFS

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/page/unpin]]

The unpin from IPFS action unpins the current wiki IPFS identifier using the [[Default API URL|$:/ipfs/saver/api]].

A dialog box will be displayed at the end of the process.

title: Verbose
text:
Verbose Setting

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/settings/verbose]]

The plugin provide feedback through dialog boxes.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/error]]

Errors are always detailed in the [[Console]]. Useful when you need to fill a bug report.

[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/error/console]]

Processing content over [[IPFS|IPFS Server Settings]] could be a lengthy process.

Every logical steps are detailed and logged to the [[Console]].

title: Version
text:
[img class="tc-image-documentation" [/ipfs/image/version]]

You can get the current ~TidlyWiki and IPFS with ~TiddlyWiki version within the Tools tab.

The plugin version is also available in the [[IPFS with TiddlyWiki|$:/plugins/ipfs]] plugin Tiddler.
